ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar with break-out rooms.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My Italian reading, writing and speaking skills greatly improved, which was what I was really hoping for! I also really liked the works we studied.

I really improved my reading and speaking skills in this class- initially I found a lot of the literature difficult to get through but it definitely got easier throughout the semester. I definitely improved on some of the verb tenses that I was iffy on before. The work we did in the second half of the semester on translations was also really interesting, and the practice we did with it was really valuable. I feel a lot more confident with speaking and writing than I did at the beginning of the semester.
I improved my Italian writing, reading, and speaking while exploring the interesting theme of Magical Realism in Italian literature and film.

I primarily developed a greater proficiency  and comfort with the Italian language in reading, speaking, analysis, and translation. I secondarily learned about Magical Realist literature and the themes with which this genre engages. By focusing mostly on the literature, this course made me feel like I could move beyond Italian as just a language to study, and into a language which I know well but need to refine in order to read more complex texts.
Just a great course!! Improved pronunciation and comprehension in Italian by having a clear lens to analyze literature and film.

Through this course, I learned a lot more about Italian literature and further developed my conversation skills through the use of breakout rooms. The topic of magical realism was really interesting, so it was great to explore that through literature and film viewings. The structure of the class allowed us to analyze text and films in smaller discussions, which was actually useful in becoming more comfortable with conversation. Moreover, I gained skills and experience in translation between Italian and other languages

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I really loved most of the texts/ movies we worked with! I also liked the discussions we had and I liked that we didn't have many restrictions for our papers because it really allowed me to choose creative things to think about.

strengths- Sarah is an INCREDIBLE instructor, workload is higher in the beginning of the semester and lighter towards midterm season which was really well planned, literature and films were really interesting, combination of class discussion and breakout rooms during class time makes it easy to stay focused and engaged, homework was really helpful for practicing Italian, received clear feedback on assignments
weaknesses- sometimes its kind of awkward to be in a breakout room with just one other student so I would have preferred having breakout rooms with larger groups, presentations can be anxiety inducing if social anxiety is something you struggle with but that is just an essential part of language classes

This class was wonderful and set up well for student learning. I really liked the degree of creativity that we had on all of our assignments because it gave students a chance to explore areas of Italian literature and film. Overall, a great class!

The projects for this course were very well designed, with a series of short reflections which exist to stimulate Italian practice and get your thoughts out there, and a final translation project which requires a more rigorous engagement with the language and its grammar. If I were to improve the course, I would want to study fewer texts, as while it was impressive how much breadth we got out of this course, the course worked best when we had a sustained engagement with one text or film, rather than jumping around too much.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I actually really liked the online format of this course, compared to some of my other seminars. Sarah made really good use of breakout rooms, which is super important for a discussion seminar.

Sarah definitely made the most effort to make online classes great out of all of my professors this semester. I think breaking up class time with a combination of class discussion, breakout rooms, and individual class reflections was really effective and helped me stay focus during the hour and fifteen minute class. Also, organizing the course so that it has a heavier workload at the start of the semester really helped me get back into Italian after summer break, and it was really helpful to have a lighter workload in this class during a busy midterm season for other classes. I feel that the workload was really manageable, but effective in helping me improve my Italian.
I really liked the "sillabo vivente" that Sarah used and the breakout rooms

The frequent use of breakout rooms to facilitate interpersonal conversation was very effective in this course. Of all my courses, this one handled the pandemic situation the best, and needed to because of how difficult language instruction could be otherwise.
Breakout rooms work great for facilitating discussion and breaking up the class time.
I was pleasantly surprised by how well the class went through zoom and I thought the live syllabus and break down of exercises were successful in keeping the class fresh and engaged.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, definitely! Sarah is a great teacher and the discussions were super interesting. I wouldn't recommend this course to someone who gets nervous presenting (especially in Italian), though, because we had to do many presentations throughout the semester.

100% yes. Or any course with Sarah. Even if you aren't trying to get your Italian certificate or major in it, I think it is a really interesting and fun class that is flexible enough so that you can incorporate your own interests for the projects and assignments.
Yes, it was a great class and Sarah is a wonderful professor!!!

I came into the course under-confident about my Italian abilities, as I had not taken any Italian course in more than a year, and had not been very good at my Italian before that. By the end of it, I felt very comfortable with my ability to translate and analyze complex works. I would recommend this to any student aiming to improve their Italian, but especially to the student who is similarly under-confident about their proficiency in the Italian language and wants to take their Italian a step further.
YES! Sarah is amazing!!!
Yes! The content was great and Sarah is an amazing instructor!
